feed.title: Google Cloud: Google Cloud Managed Service for Apache Kafka
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Google Cloud Managed Service for Apache Kafka

entry.content: General availability: You can now use mutual TLS (mTLS) for certificate-based authentication with your Managed Service for Apache Kafka brokers. This feature is available for clusters created after June 24, 2025. For more information, see Authentication types for Kafka brokers.
entry.summary: Mutual TLS (mTLS) authentication is now generally available for Managed Service for Apache Kafka, enhancing security for your Kafka clusters. This feature supports certificate-based authentication and is available for clusters created after June 24, 2025. For detailed information, refer to the official documentation on authentication types.
entry.title: Feature: Mutual TLS (mTLS) for Apache Kafka Now Generally Available

entry.summary: We're excited to announce that the integration with VPC Service Controls for Kafka is now available in preview. This feature allows you to enhance your data security by controlling network access to your Kafka services.
entry.title: Feature: VPC Service Controls integration for Kafka is now in preview

entry.content: Managed Service for Apache Kafka now supports HIPAA Compliance on Google Cloud.
entry.summary: Managed Service for Apache Kafka now supports HIPAA compliance, allowing you to run sensitive workloads in the cloud.
entry.title: Feature: Managed Service for Apache Kafka now HIPAA compliant

entry.content: The Google Cloud Managed Service for Apache Kafka service creates new brokers automatically based on the memory and vCPU configuration of the cluster. When you update a cluster's size, the service now performs a safety check to verify that individual brokers have sufficient capacity for their portion of the traffic. For more information, see Update the memory and vCPUs.
entry.summary: Auto-creation of Kafka brokers based on cluster configuration.
entry.title: Feature: Kafka Broker Autoscaling

entry.content: General availability: Metrics for all Google Cloud Managed Service for Apache Kafka resources are now available, with some exceptions. Exceptions include the request_count and topic_error_count metrics for Kafka clusters and Kafka Connect connectors. For a list of supported metrics, see Metrics for Cloud Managed Service for Apache Kafka.
entry.summary: Metrics for all Google Cloud Managed Service for Apache Kafka resources are now available. For a list of supported metrics, see the documentation.
entry.title: Feature: Metrics for Managed Service for Apache Kafka Now Available

entry.content: Public preview: Google Managed Service for Apache Kafka now offers schema registry support. For more information about the feature, see the schema registry overview or get started with an Avro producer in Java.
entry.summary: Google Managed Service for Apache Kafka now supports schema registry, a centralized repository for managing data schemas. This feature helps ensure data compatibility and consistency across your data streams.
entry.title: Feature: Managed Kafka adds schema registry support
